meanings.sent1: I needed quick cash, so I ended up hocking my old watch.
meanings.sent2: He decided to hock his guitar to pay for the repairs.
meanings.sent3: After hocking my bike, I regretted not saving up instead.
meanings.sent4: She hocked her necklace, parting with a piece of her past.
meanings.sent5: The man was hocking his tools, hoping for a better tomorrow.

meanings.definition: To clear (land) by cutting down trees
meanings.sent1: The company was hocking the forest to make space for a new building.
meanings.sent2: They hocked the area to create a beautiful park for everyone to enjoy.
meanings.sent3: The lumberjacks were hocking the trees, making way for progress.
meanings.sent4: The sound of hocking echoed through the forest as trees fell.
meanings.sent5: Hocking the land, they prepared for a fresh start in the community.

meanings.definition: To cough up or spit out (phlegm)
meanings.sent1: He was hocking up phlegm due to his cold.
meanings.sent2: The sick child hocked out the phlegm into a tissue.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about hocking phlegm in an exaggerated manner.
meanings.sent4: She felt like hocking out the phlegm was the highlight of her day.
meanings.sent5: The old man's loud hocking startled everyone in the room.
